transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Hi Zhi, this is Arjun from MongoDB. Have you got a moment?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Thanks. I saw Acme Corp. has been focused on cost optimization lately, and I wanted to ask about your experience with Snowflake—and if you’ve explored alternatives for workloads, especially those that need flexibility or scale.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, we’re always looking at costs. We’re pretty deep into Snowflake, though. Switching would be a big lift.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Totally understand. Many healthcare teams use both—Snowflake for analytics, and MongoDB Atlas for high-volume, operational apps. Atlas can actually reduce compute spend by right-sizing workloads and offers flexible, consumption-based billing.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Right, but we have a three-year deal with Snowflake. And to be honest, we’re worried about performance spikes—especially at peak loads with compliance requirements.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: That’s fair. Atlas is HIPAA certified, and we have customers in healthcare running mission-critical apps with sub-millisecond latency—auto-scaling is built in, so you don’t get surprise costs or slowdowns during surges. We’re designed for compliance and predictable performance.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Still, our team’s worried about vendor lock-in. What if we outgrow MongoDB or want to migrate again later?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Great question. Atlas is fully managed, but you’re never locked in—you can always export your data, and our licensing is open. Plus, our tooling makes migrations reversible and low-risk.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Okay. And...what about migration costs? That’s a non-starter for us if it’s huge.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Absolutely. For healthcare clients, we often help with migration planning and sometimes cover some costs during onboarding. It comes down to use case, but we’re pretty flexible on terms—far from a one-size-fits-all contract.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Alright. It’s interesting. But we’d need a lot more details.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Of course. Would it make sense to set up a quick discovery call next week? I can loop in our solutions architect, answer your team’s questions, and even prep a TCO analysis.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, let’s get something on the calendar.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Perfect. I’ll send over a few time slots—thanks for your time today, Zhi.
